snippet: The identification of one of the gunmen in the attack that killed nearly 150 students as the son of a local chief near the Somali border rekindled fears of a homegrown terrorism problem.
abstract: Kenyan authorities report that one of gunmen involved in massacre at Garissa University College in Kenya was Abdirahim Abdullahi, son of local government official; discovery has stoked fears that violence there is not only stemming from chaos in neighboring Somalia but may be more homegrown; Adbullahi is reported to have quit his job to join militant group Shabab.

byline.original: By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN and ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH

lead_paragraph: The identification of one of the gunmen in the attack that killed nearly 150 students as the son of a local chief near the Somali border rekindled fears of a homegrown terrorism problem.

headline.main: Kenyan Authorities Say Son of Official Was Among Gunmen in University Attack
headline.print_headline: Kenyans Identify Campus Attacker as Son of a Government Official
